tagline: SCADA-grade monitoring and anomaly detection for electrical substations and grid assets.
capabilities: Multivariate time-series anomaly detection across load, voltage, frequency, and thermal signals
Substation-level health scoring with temporal context
Early warning detection for voltage sag, thermal drift, and abnormal load ramps
Fleet-wide comparison and regime clustering across substations
Grace-period-aware alerting to reduce false positives during transient events
Root-cause hints via correlated signal deviation analysis

runbooks.title: Voltage sag detected
steps: Confirm whether the event coincides with scheduled switching or maintenance windows
Compare phase voltages across adjacent feeders to rule out sensor-level issues
Check recent load ramp rates for abrupt changes exceeding historical baselines
Inspect transformer oil temperature for correlated thermal stress
If sustained beyond 10 minutes, escalate to field operations for inspection

runbooks.title: Abnormal load ramp
steps: Validate load change against historical diurnal patterns for the substation
Cross-check upstream generation and downstream demand signals
Inspect frequency stability during the ramp period
Assess whether the anomaly propagates to peer substations
Classify as transient vs structural before triggering customer-facing alerts

runbooks.title: Thermal drift anomaly
steps: Verify oil temperature sensor calibration and recent maintenance logs
Check ambient temperature conditions and cooling system status
Correlate thermal readings with sustained load increases
Review historical thermal trends for seasonal baseline shifts
Escalate if temperature exceeds safe operating thresholds

faqs.q: How does GridSense distinguish between transient events and true anomalies?
faqs.a: GridSense applies temporal context and grace-period-aware scoring, allowing short-lived transients (such as switching operations) to decay without triggering alerts unless deviations persist or propagate across correlated signals.

faqs.q: Is GridSense intended to replace SCADA systems?
faqs.a: No. GridSense complements existing SCADA infrastructure by providing higher-level analytics, anomaly detection, and fleet-wide insight without interfering with control systems.

faqs.q: What data resolution does GridSense require?
faqs.a: GridSense supports input resolutions from sub-minute telemetry to 5-minute aggregates, with detection sensitivity adapting to the available sampling rate.
